definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: Once upon a barren moor there dwelt a bear, also a boar.
sentences.chinese: 从前，在一个贫瘠的荒野里住了一只熊和一只公野猪。

sentences.english: He slaughtered the ox and the ram as the fellowship offering for the people.
sentences.chinese: 亚伦宰了那给百姓作平安祭的公牛和公绵羊。

sentences.english: The priest's two male parrots are holding rosary beads and praying in their cage.
sentences.chinese: 牧师的两只公鹦鹉正夹着念珠在笼子里作玫瑰经祷告。

sentences.english: That day, he removed the male goats that were streaked and spotted.
sentences.chinese: 当天拉班就将有条纹有斑点的公山羊。

sentences.english: A male crab asked a female crab to marry him.
sentences.chinese: 一只公螃蟹向母螃蟹求婚。

sentences.english: He immediately got angry and squawked at her.
sentences.chinese: 公鹌鹑立刻大发脾气并朝母鹌鹑大叫起来。

sentences.english: We were unaware that you had a Brother, Lord Protector.
sentences.chinese: 我们不知道你还有一个兄弟啊，护国公陛下。

sentences.english: But it is different than the female crab crab and more expensive.
sentences.chinese: 不过和国内不同的是，这里公螃蟹要比母螃蟹贵得多。

sentences.english: Defining the commons is also vital.
sentences.chinese: 对于“公地”的定义同样关键。

sentences.english: An ink ring is also good, is a male, the first type of good.
sentences.chinese: 一只墨环也不错，是个公的，头型挺好。

sentences.english: It is accessible from the public pedestrian footbridges at Castle Peak Road and On Shun Street.
sentences.chinese: 可由青山公路及安信街的公众行人天桥前往。

sentences.english: To overdo anything public may lead to jobbery while appropriate selfishness may promote the growth.
sentences.chinese: “公”字过头可能假公济私，私心适度也会促进发展。

sentences.english: He is to slaughter the lamb in the holy place where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered.
sentences.chinese: 把公羊羔宰于圣地，就是宰赎罪祭牲和燔祭牲之地。

sentences.english: Wild boar estrus none seasonally and mate all the year.
sentences.chinese: 公野猪发情无季节性，可以常年配种。

sentences.english: Every new enclosure of the commons involves the infringement of somebody's personal liberty.
sentences.chinese: 每次公地被圈围，都侵犯了一些人的个人自由。

sentences.english: And one he-goat for a sin - offering;
sentences.chinese: 又要献一只公山羊为赎罪祭。

definition: father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
to serve as an official/an official/the two chess pieces in Chinese chess guarding the "general" or "king" 將|将[jiang4]
marquis, second of the five orders of ancient Chinese nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/nobleman or high official
see 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] and 閼氏|阏氏[yan1 zhi1]
